Fe3 but when the Gover- nor of that city pointed out the banks of the river Salado, to build the new colony upon, the Abipones disapproved of that situation, and a business of so much import was consequently suspended: for Ychoalay, who possessed much more penetration than the rest, said that the Spaniards had pitched upon that situation with a design of rendering the Abipones sub- servient to their will, as they had done with regard to the remainder of the Calchacuis in Carcarafial. The dread of slavery disconcerted these useful measures, to the great disadvantage both of the SpaniardS, and of themselves. By what means the whole Abiponian nation was settled in four colonieS, remains to be circum- stantially related.
